data.title: tscn/tres: Inconsistencies in the extension filters of the save/open file dialogs
data.body:
In the current master branch (46c5fda), there are some inconsistencies in the listing of formats in the save and open file dialogs of the editor + project settings:
- In the project settings, the .tscn format is missing. _Fixed_
- In the "Open Scene" and "New Inherited Scene" dialogs, the filters are listed as:
  ![filter-open](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/11456556/fa690d2a-968c-11e5-92ed-5db612d8a45d.png)
  - TRES ( *.tres ) is missing (if RES is supported, I guess TRES would be too)
  - Since the new T-formats are meant to replace the XML-formats, they should probably be moved up in the list
- In the "Save Scene As.." dialog, the filters are:
  ![filter-save](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4701338/11456569/4fc2be4c-968d-11e5-8c5c-de9911f4d6fd.png)
  - Here all formats are shown, but "_.tscn" is missing from the "All recognized" list while "_.tres" is there, which looks a bit weird.
  - Just like above, the T-formats should be moved up.
  - The order is different from the "Open Scene" dialogs where it was more natural: first the scene-specific format, then the general format. So it should be: SCN, RES, TSCN, TRES, XSCN, XML.
- For both dialogs, if we want users to start using T-formats preferentially over XML formats, maybe the XML formats could be removed altogether from the "All recognized" shortlist (but kept as available filters of course).

data.title: display modes for invisible objects 2d editor (boundbox)
data.body:
This is a feature request! 

Can we have display modes in the 2d editor too?

So it would be easier to work on the levels, even when some objects are invisible.

Something like this:
![displaymode-boundbox-godot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/13174433/11456461/7b72df06-9668-11e5-9454-8e4ea5388e38.jpeg)

(sorry my english)

data.title: Add ability to set "keep screen on" for android & iOS. fixes #2428
data.body:
Can change "Set Keep Screen On" at Project settings.

2 methods are added to `OS`.

```
OS::set_keep_screen_on(bool)
bool OS::is_keep_screen_on()
```

I made another PR instead of #2943

data.title: Add ability to set "keep screen on" for android & iOS. fixes #2428
data.body:
Can change "Set Keep Screen On" at Project settings.

2 methods are added to `OS`.

```

bool OS::is_keep_screen_on()
```

Fixes #2280

data.title: Fix shader loading, making possible load .shd and .sgp from editor
data.body:
I tested this today, but i'm not sure if it broke something, so please test before merging.

Closes #2917.

data.title: Fix editor help scroll to result
data.body: Closes #2856.

data.title: Some WorldEnvironment features disable "transparent_bg" in a Viewport
data.body:
I'm using a viewport to show a 3D model in a 2D environment with a ViewportSprite. The sprite background is transparent (transparent_bg property is true).
But as soon as I have a WorldEnvironment and switch on features like Fxaa or Ambient Light, the transparent background is gone, and the ViewportSprite gets a plain black background instead. Even if I set the background colour in the WorldEnvironment to something transparent (alpha = 0), it doesn't work, the viewport background remains black.

data.title: Clean up Opus build command arguments
data.body: Remove the need of directory includes and compiler variables specifically for the Opus library.

data.title: Label text disappearing inside a viewport node
data.body:
When Label autowrap is enabled, the label text dissapears inside the Viewport.

Can be easily tested with  the "GUI in 3D" demo.

data.title: Moved subscene creation from scene menu to an icon on the scene dock
data.body:
Based on @Fiona's PR #2220.
The previous "subscene" concept is also renamed to "new scene", as those subscene are just like regular scenes.

I think it's a nice enhancement; there is one issue though: the default width of the scene tree dock is now too small for all the icons to fit, so the padding between icons or the default width of docks should be changed a bit.

data.title: Replace hardcoded references to Okam Studio by Godot Engine
data.body:
Since the engine development is now independent.
Fixes #2836.

@punto- I'll let you have a look at some of those files are iOS related and I just blinded changed them :)
There are still two references to Okam Studio that I did not modify as they were copyright mentions, I'll let you see if the copyright is correct or if it should be changed to you and @reduz + MIT header.
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/tools/ios_xcode_template/godot_iosTests/godot_iosTests.m#L6
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/tools/ios_xcode_template/godot_ios/main.m#L6

data.title: Bug Fix #2541: Shader language function validation logic
data.body: ensures that it finds the correct function to validate.

data.body:
If the software to re-create "sheyps" on the screen in debug mode will not be shown correctly (old version)

an example can be seen that the bullet had to face the asteroids but it does not happen because the size of the figure is less than he had seen on the screen
![godot 2015-11-27 13-16-48-78](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/233268/11440872/51dda34e-9517-11e5-8bf1-c23113b5b7ab.jpg)

data.title: Wrong operator used in Vector3::operator<=
Ability to export data.pck only
data.body: Some people used the -export command line param without a destination binary in the past to create the data.pck file only. This however doesn't work anymore, see #2921 and #2843. Workaround right now is to specify the destination binary, and then pick the data.pck from the same directory as the target binary.

data.title: Added set_hidden method to Spatial and CanvasItem
Print error if no export destination has been passed
data.body:
Closes #2843.

Its not perfect, as it should probably also check whether one wants to export into the project folder, but that check can be added later on as well.
Such a change can then also improve the check in project_export.cpp method `ProjectExportDialog::_export_action`.

data.title: Clean search help results at script tab
data.body:
Could you give a option to clean search help results or disable it?  My script tab get flooded with these history results together with scripts.

data.title: Update Groups Editor
data.body:
Small groups editor update.
- Group names are sorted.
- Add delete button on each item, and removed side delete button.
- Implement undo redo when removing a group.

data.title: Add script auto-completion for function parameters
data.body: Closes #2519.

data.title: Can save shader to shd or sgp, but can't load it from editor
data.body:
I can create material and shader like this.

Sprite > CanvasItemMaterial > CanvasItemShader (or CanvasItemShaderGraph)

And I also can save CanvasItemShader to `.shd` file or CanvasItemShaderGraph to `.sgp`,
but can't load it again from editor.
It shows only `*.res, *.xml, *.tres`
